content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Lancashire

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Lancashire
fields.bodyText: Big year for Sajid Mahmood Time has come to prove himself a fast bowler of true international pedigree In a nutshell Peter Moores' diligence and enthusiasm should benefit a young Lancashire squad during a testing summer. Moores' priority when he guided Sussex to their first championship in 2003 was to make them the fittest team in the land. Expect more of the same Ashes factor Old Trafford has been overlooked on the Test schedule despite England's excellent record at the ground Foreign flavour Indians in county cricket are not as common these days, but VVS Laxman could have the Lancashire membership purring when he arrives at the end of May Well I never VVS Laxman pulled out of his medical school entrance exams at 18, promising he would return if he did not make it in cricket within four years David Hopps Bob Willis's verdict Another season, another upheaval, with a new coach in Peter Moores and a new captain in Glen Chapple. The signings of Ashwell Prince and VVS Laxman could be pivotal. They have, as always, lots of good young cricketers, as well as strength in seam bowling and can finish in the top three
